title: Hairline Display Serif (HTF Chronicle like)
content:
[md70.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20130915054252/http:/www.md70.com/) main logo. Closest I've found is HTF Chronicle Display Extra-Light. Any idea? Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130915054252im_/http:/typophile.com/files/test_5952.gif)
author: Ryuk

comments.content:
It looks like a synthesis of [Firmin Didot](http://web.archive.org/web/20130915054252/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/firmin-didot/) and my own Marquet Titling (below), based on the 19th century work of Théophile Beaudoire. Anyway, it's very French! Almost looks like it could be a display version of Sabon, if there were such a thing.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130915054252im_/http:/typophile.com/files/marquet_6477.gif)
Thank you both of you for these suggestions. May be some would have more...

The 'D' is very much like that in [Perpetua Titling](http://web.archive.org/web/20130915054252/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/perpetua_titling_roman/?sample_text=MD70&sample_size=96) and the '7' like [Big Caslon](http://web.archive.org/web/20130915054252/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/carter_cone/big_caslon_cc/?sample_text=MD70&sample_size=96).
Indeed... CC Big Caslon comes very close. Thanks once more Stephen!
